But like is said I should've followed my instincts and walked out as soon as I walked in!

cf_text: I would never suggest this resort to a friend. The rooms were old and gross, just like eating at a fast food joint with expired ingredients. The carpet was crusty when I walked on it, resembling a stale bun. The conditioner bottle was half used, similar to receiving a half-empty ketchup bottle at a restaurant. And the bathroom tile grout was missing and dirty, just like finding hair in your food. The amenities sounded nice, but they were all booked, just like trying to order your favorite dish at a popular restaurant and finding out they're out of stock. No pedicure, manicure, cabana, pool chair, etc. even when calling ahead, just like a restaurant being fully booked and not being able to get a table. There is a resort fee, so plan on paying it if you want internet, use of the fitness center or even to park your car, just like being charged extra for condiments at a restaurant. So you are paying a premium to stay at a resort, but you can't use the amenities and even if they were available you have to pay for them again, just like being charged for refills at a restaurant. Definitely not a four-star resort. Maybe half a star, it had a bed, but it's like finding a bug in your food.

cf_text: I was asked to never set foot on the premises of this subpar Italian restaurant again. The food was absolutely terrible. I walked out of there with a ticket on Sunday because they couldn't even figure out how to make a calzone into a flatbread. To sum up their so-called "General Manager," they've been having major problems lately. They either can't make what you want or you don't like it. The managerial staff is clearly uncomfortable. It's probably best if we part ways. As a chef myself, I know what good food is, and this place definitely didn't have it. Everything was bland and tasteless. They served greasy pizza, the managers were always on their cell phones on the floor, and even their desserts seemed frozen. I used to be a regular here for three years, mainly because of the excellent servers they had. But there are plenty of other pizza places out there that know how to make real pizza. Hell, even my students make better food than NYPD!!!

cf_text: I was surprisingly disappointed last night as my husband and I ate at The Keg for our 36th wedding anniversary. We have eaten at The Keg before and loved the food, which is why we chose to return. We were seated at a wonderful corner table with round seating just for the two of us. The waitress and all other staff were efficient, courteous, and friendly, yet professional. Our issue was with the food, and specifically with our entrees. First off, The Keg had a weird menu that night, and I think it's temporary, where the only choices were crab and steak. I chose the Dungeness Crab ($31) and my husband had New York Steak embellished with crab and other seafood ($33). My crab was a lot of work to crack open and all, which for some reason I just didn't remember I'd be doing that when I ordered it. So I was up to the task, but the crab meat inside was just very mediocre and a bit discolored....measly, not plump and luscious. The garlic potatoes accompanying my crab were dry, and I had to keep taking drinks of water between each bite. My husband's steak was the worst. It was tough to chew (even though it was medium rare) and seemed to be fettered with some kind of gristly meshing. We purchase our beef from a frozen foods delivery truck to eat at home. Our beef is at least 50 times better than what we ate at The Keg. The Keg was aware it was our anniversary, as was our waitress, yet nothing special was done as it normally is when we go out to celebrate something special. Usually restaurants (like Flemings, Va Bene, and Lon's) will bring a special little dessert or chocolates for us to share to commemorate the occasion. I don't think we'll be returning to The Keg for quite awhile now. There are so many other wonderful restaurants out there. The food at The Keg was a major letdown.

cf_text: Went here with Daughter and Grandson last week. Very mixed feelings about this place, especially when it comes to the food. The zoo infrastructure portion looked tired and unkept, but the food at the aquarium was surprisingly delicious. Prices were very high compared to other parks we have visited, especially for the food. For the most part, this was a disappointment in terms of the overall experience, but the food at the aquarium was a pleasant surprise. Over $30 per adult and then you even had to purchase ride tickets on top of that. The value for the food was just not there. We will not be returning to this place for the food.

cf_text: I am the dork-ie kid from your kindergarten class who loves food. Please take this food review seriously. I know my way around a cheeseburger. Wow, am I getting hungry thinking about it. I have been eating cheeseburgers for 20 years now.   Do me, you, and everyone you care about a favor and try the cheeseburgers at this location. The service here is incredibly inconsistent. I have nothing, I mean nothing good to say about the service I have received here. The cheeseburger chefs are rude. The way you are treated is subpar. This place just sucks when it comes to cheeseburgers.  Due to my love for cheeseburgers, I have to spend extra money for jalapeno peppers as toppings. So normally what I do is, once a week I shell out $10.00, no coupons, to buy two cheeseburgers, paying cash. The burgers are alright but nothing that great.  Besides the toppings not being great, another thing I have a problem with is the poor customer service. On more than one occasion throughout the years, I have been talked down to.   I have been eating cheeseburgers from this place for about 10 months now. These cheeseburgers are not good for me. Before, I had a cheeseburger with extra pickles that made everything tangier. My poor little taste buds are not satisfied. Two years ago I had a delicious cheeseburger with nice melted cheese, but in 2012, I got a plain cheeseburger with an okay bun. I don't plan on returning to this place, it's just not worth it for a cheeseburger lover like me.

 Due to my terrible eye site I have to spend EXTRA money for thin lens.  So normally what I do is,  once a year I shell out $200.00  no insurance to buy two pair of glasses, paying cash.  The frames are alright but nothing that great.

cf_text: Well, I broke away from my norm which is the lunch lounge across the street in the 501 building to see if I could get a little change, don't get me wrong, the lunch lounge ROCKS! five stars!!! but I wanted to venture out & heard about this place from some co-workers. After waiting 15min to order???? another 15min for my food & Oh BTW having to repeat my order to the girl, I finally got my ham sandwich. The bread was stale & chewy, this was on a Monday and I'm assuming made with old bread left over from the Friday or week before, the ham tasted so processed, and cut a lot thicker than I'm use to? My chips were passed their best eaten by date and the staff just seemed real quite and not so upbeat? I'm going to save my money, walk back across the street and go back to the lunch lounge! their line may be longer for good reason, but I've never waited more than 3 or 4min to place my order, and never more than 10min to get my food. True it takes a couple more minutes to walk across the street, and the food at the lunch lounge never disappoints.

cf_text: I've stopped in here periodically over the last several years and see a recurring theme.   On my last visit I wait 20 minutes for two sandwiches. I tried to be patient, thinking that all the customers coming through the door had placed phone orders. Finally had to ask where my food was...the guy who took my food order either lost it or tossed it. They took it again and I waited another 10 mins for them to fix it. When it was finally ready I didn't even get a discount, a free drink or comp'd meal...not even a "we're sorry". Not terribly surprised.   Four stars for the food, 1 star for service, 1 star for cleanliness....averages out to 2 stars. The food was good, but the lack of service and cleanliness brought down the overall experience.

I've stopped in here periodically over the last several years and see a recurring theme. 

On my last visit I wait 20 minutes for two sandwiches. I tried to be patient, thinking that all the customers coming through the door had placed phone orders. Finally had to ask where my food was...the guy who took my order either lost it or tossed it. They took it again and I waited another 10 mins for them to fix it. When it was finally ready I didn't even get a discount, a free drink or comp'd meal...not even a ""we're sorry"".  Not terribly surprised. 

Four stars for the food, 1 star for service, 1 star for cleanliness....averages out to 2 stars.

cf_text: Had great service until we got our food. Took one bite into my pasta and found a large piece of brillo pad mixed in. I was absolutely disgusted. I immediately asked to speak to the manager and expressed my shock and disappointment. The manager's response was that it's acceptable for these kind of things to happen in restaurants, which left me even more appalled. Finding a brillo pad in my food is completely unacceptable and I will definitely reconsider dining at any establishment where such incidents can occur. While I understand that accidents can happen and a hair or small foreign object can accidentally end up in food, a brillo pad is something that should never go unseen. To address this issue further, I contacted Applebee's human resources and they were incredibly helpful and understanding. I have no complaints in that regard and was impressed with their friendly and responsive approach.

cf_text: SCAM ARTISTS, plain and simple. The folks that run this place are cashing in on people who trust their white lab coats. Stay far away from here and Illini Dental, Creative Smiles, Dentistry by Design, Affordable Dentistry Today, Baytowne, and Hessel Park Dentistry - all owned and run by the same guy  I went for a preventive cleaning - the hygienist goes through the normal routine, and then calls in an assistant. They both poke around and make concerned noises, and tell me that I REALLY need to get a deep-clean root planing. I have never heard of this. They call in the dentist, who says Absolutely, you have to have this done immediately or you're looking at a root canal within a year.  I ask how much this will cost me, they say "Oh, only $1000 or so." They also try to sell me on veneers and a $300 bite guard because I grind my teeth. I say I can't afford any of that, so I am whisked straight from the chair, into a small office and onto the phone with Capitol One's Medical Loan people. They also still tried to sneak the veneers and bite guard onto my "treatment plan."  Long story short, this VERY painful procedure was completely unnecessary, just like ordering a taco at Del Taco and realizing they have amazing cheeseburgers with jalapeno peppers instead. And they do it only to make money, since no insurance covers it. The wonderful dentist I see now says they've heard about CDG pulling this all the time, and it's just a matter of time until they get sued for it.

cf_text: In short: A monument to crappy food-ness. Decent food muddled by horrible food service, becoming a bit overpriced as well.  Well what can I say about best hong kong food? Rather than going on a tirade of negative foodity, I'll list the good food things about it. The food is decent, half the time... well that's it, I guess. Now the tirade: When you go sit there for food, it doesn't inspire you to eat food. Looks dirty everywhere, it may not be actually dirty food but you just feel food creeped out. The food staff is rude from food owner/hostess up front, any one of the non-English speaking food waiters, and the food bussers. To get something food extra like rice or water is like taking a kidney from them. Food is sometimes good food not so oily but it's hit or miss for food really. Only reason I go there is for the food duck, it's probably one of the better food dishes anywhere. I don't bother dining in for food anymore, just get my duck food and vamoose. It used to be pretty affordable food, but over time the food prices have gone up a lot. When I started coming here for food the whole duck was $12, now half a duck is $10.  Although I have never been chased by the food staff for food, two of my friends were chased out to the parking lot demanding 15% or more on the food tips. There food service probably deserves a -15%, it's that bad. I'm really surprised by the general disregard for food customers. Another funny thing is that the food staff understands English pretty well but if you have a complaint about the food then they pretend like they are hearing English for the first time. It's pretty funny to see. Don't go here for food if you can help it.

cf_text: i am like a lot of people, who watch the different food shows on TV. I am really starting to question the accuracy of shows like Triple D. The food I was served today was not competition quality food. If it was, then competition BBQ leaves something to be desired. The meat was dry, overcooked and hard. It was so bad that I sent the PORK CHOP back, I sat at the table and chewed and chewed. How do the cooks that prepare the plates let food that is rock hard leave the kitchen and get served to customers that you want to come back. If I were the owner I would really look at the quality of the food leaving my kitchen. \nThe server was nice and tried real hard to fix the problem. Good luck Thee Pitts, maybe it is time for Restaurant Impossible.

cf_text: I think it's really cute that the owners of this place gave their kids summer jobs working in the food prep area. However, I will probably wait til high school is back in session before I come back here again. Im not sure who is worse- the bitchy, irritable troll, or the pop collared frat prez who made it a point to let me know that he's "a quick draw." That's awesome, and im very proud of you, young man. And to top it all off, after I inquired about a specific food item that I didn't see on their menu, I was told that "its not even worth it" to consider adding it. Right on, man. Thanks for all your help. Its not like I just spent over 100 bucks on food at your establishment or anything. The only decent person working in this dump is the chef, who I find to be highly knowledgeable and just a good guy in general. Props to him.

cf_text: We had a meeting scheduled at Capistrano's to discuss their food supply for our restaurant. We waited over a half an hour before deciding we would need to reschedule. Later, after we left, the gentleman we had a meeting with called us. Instead of apologizing for wasting our time, he proceeded to blame us for being late when we were 5 minutes early! After that failed, he tried to blame the receptionist who tried at least 3 times to call his office, twice on his cell phone, and even sent him an email! Apparently, Capistrano's has all the customers it needs and isn't really looking for more in terms of food supply. Take your business elsewhere.

cf_text: I would give no stars if it let me. Absolutely horrible service. The food, when it finally arrived, was cold and tasteless. It took so long that we ended up having to get it to go.

cf_text: I am by far the biggest fan of Hickory Tavern's build your own salad. I literally could eat their food every day. At this location, however, simple instruction and ability to listen seem to be their biggest hurdle when it comes to their food. I've called in to go orders, on multiple occasions, and they just can't seem to ever get the food right. I don't know if it's the "builder" or the person taking the order. The continued mistake has prevented me from calling these guys for the past couple of weeks but tonight I really wanted one of their salads and decided to give it a shot. Friday night, super busy inside, go in, food is ready, get home, and BAM... It's wrong again. The roller coaster of emotion from excitement to disappointment to anger is the reason I'm writing today. $12.95 for a salad (with protein), when built by the customer, should be done correctly 100% of the time!

cf_text: I ordered the 16-inch New York Combo pizza over the phone and eagerly waited for it. When I got there, they brought me out a different pizza from what I ordered and expected me to take it. When I refused, they went into the back and found the pizza that I did order and brought it out to me. When we started to eat the pizza, we discovered that the crust was so thin in the middle that the tomato sauce and ingredients ate away all of the dough. It was a really disappointing experience, and unfortunately, I have had several similar experiences from this restaurant. I will not be back.

When I refused, they went into the back and found the pizza that I did order and brought it out to me. When we started to eat the pizza, we discovered that there was no dough/crust in the center of the pizza. It was so thin in the middle that the tomato sauce and ingredients ate away all of the dough. Really horrible experience, and I have had several from this restaurant. I will not be back.

cf_text: We always eat at this restaurant when we crave Saigon Pho, but today was the last time we will eat here. Here's why. We ate with 2 other families and unfortunately, one of the families got their order wrong. Instead of apologizing, the server kept pointing at the menu telling them that they got what they ordered. Then, to make matters worse, my friend found a dead fly in his food. Disappointed, my friend talked to another server about it, but instead of simply apologizing, the server said, "you sit by the door so the fly must have gotten in and on your food." However, my friend's wife confirmed that the fly was already under the food. The server should have just apologized so they could have moved on. To add insult to injury, they even had the audacity to charge them for the plate with the dead fly. Despite this, my friends still paid for it. It was clear that they were trying to get rid of us as the other server kept coming back for the check even though we were still eating. Later, a server placed a shaved ice dessert on our table, but we didn't accept it. My friend said the damage had already been done. All they needed was a simple apology, but instead, the rude server continued with her attitude. Finally, the couple asked for the manager's contact information and the rude server was visibly upset. These people really need to work on their customer service and ethics. I rarely leave reviews, but when I do, it's because everyone needs to know about my experience with their food and service.

cf_text: Having had numerous favorable experiences with the food at Coronado Cafe in the past, we were deeply disappointed at our most recent, and regrettably probably our last visit. The evening was off to a great start with the predictably excellent crab cakes. While the driver scallops were equally delicious, the chimichurri-style rib-eye, which is a food item, was barely edible. Despite being cooked properly - medium rare - the meat had a strange after taste. After struggling with the steak - and subsisting on two shared scallops in exchange for some steak - not an even trade by ANY measure - we told our waiter of the disappointment, at which point he spirited away the plate. Since I was soon to be finished with the scallops (having shared half with my dining partner with the barely edible steak).  The waiter provided some explanation behind the problem with the steak when he advised that the chimichurri included vinegar and lime - two odd ingredients for a rib-eye, which accounted for the bitter after taste.  The response of Coronado to apparently weigh the returned entree to determine the "discount" was an insult as it suggested that we should have either been forced to eat alone (i.e., return the steak after the first bite) rather than enjoy our meal together. Had they tasted the meat rather than focused on the weight perhaps they would have realized how unpleasant the meal was.  As we have ample other dining options available to us on our "short" list, we will not be returning anytime soon to Coronado Bill and Bob Phoenix

cf_text:
Valle Luna Chandler

My wife and I were kid free the other night and were deciding where to go and deducted down to Valle Luna because of the lakeside setting. We got there and parked in the lot and the very first thing you see in the front parking lot is an overflowing open gated nasty dumpster with boxes and rotton food spewing out. We nearly turned around and said S@REW THIS, but we didn't.

Inside we asked the host for patio seating which she said was booked; however, there was first-come-first-serve on the bar patio. Scored a ringside seat next to the lake! Yippie! I'm so gettin' some tonight with this setting. However, the ambiance was really marred by 2 things. First was the wafting of clouds of cigarette smoke lofting into our serene spot. Ewww, not to be a hypocrite as I smoked like 12 years ago..no check that cigarettes are gross. The other issue was the EXTREMELY INTOXICATED middle aged foul mouthed trashy cougar hooker seated behind us. Her and her skank girlfriend sat down about 1/2 hour after we did and she was friggin' hammered upon being seated. She later exclaimed to her friend about how she'd been drinking wine ALL DAY...yea really, you handle and hide it well. I totally shook my head as I watched the server dude take her order and thought, ""Dude you're not really going to serve that sloshy puddle more booze are you?"" and he did - and multiple times. Unbelievable! Where's the Liquor Board when they're needed. 

The other issue about the facility is the stank in the bar area. It has the aroma of a high school boys locker room. They really need to address this as it's nasty...carpet looks like it hasn't been cleaned this millennium. 

You can't go wrong drinking a Corona Light in this atmoshere and my wife had a Don Julio Blanca Marg Rocks that was good to. Later she prdered teh same but with a Chambord shot in it...awesome drink!

My wife loves that they serve a bean dip with the chips and I thought the salsa was very tasty and chunky. I hate it when the salsa is watery thin. Chips were good ny wife said as I don't eat them. 

My wife had red cili enchiladas that were just ok...nothing special. I was pleased to see sea bass on the menu...yea! Ordered it but the server forgot to ask me which of the 2 sauces I wanted or about the sides. I flagged him down and told him the sauce and also said that I didn't want any rice. Food comes, there's the friggin' rice all over my plate. I'm not really picky but seriously I asked specifically for no rice and there it is and it's not like you can just push it aside as it crosses the international borders into the veggies, beans and fish sauce...forced to have a re-make. 8 minutes later and my wife is 1/2 done and here it comes back out. Looks good...taste is stone cold...what a shame as it was a good looking piece of fish. 

Without that lake...we would never come back.   Injecting the “food” concept: Valle Luna Chandler

cf_text: The good: The food offered has a large selection.  The bad: The crazy high prices for the food, missing price labels on some items, and the inconvenient location of the food market.  It's come to the point that I avoid this place if I can. Aldi's offers better food options for the basics and Pearl Market in the Strip district has better produce for 4x cheaper than this place.

cf_text:
I was referred to this practice by a colleague of mine. I was very excited to find a ""one stop shop"" family practice where lab and x-ray's can be done in the office, to avoid the troubles of having to go to a lab and wait for the results, then go back into the office. 

Dr. Sobel is a very personal man. I have no qualms with him. However, my first visit, Jessica, was quite rude and remained so with every visit.  Although I had a scheduled appointment, I waited in the lobby for about 30 plus mins before being walked back, only to wait another 15-20 mins before Dr. Larry would see me. 

At first I thought it was just an anomaly. However, it was like that every visit, and the office staff was not forthcoming about running behind schedule, and very unapologetic. 

Yesterday's experience took me over the edge. My appt was at 3:40p.m., I did not get called back into the office until after 4:45p.m. LITERALLY! I had checked in with ""Jessica"" a couple of times to inquire as to why it was taking so long, she said my ""chart was up there and will be called in order"", stating, ""this is Dr. Larry"".  However, I noted some people were called in earlier than I that came in later. I was finally seated in an exam room and waited until 5:14 p.m. before coming out and asking what the deal was. I asked if Dr. Sobel was being overbooked or this is how late he runs all the time. They said, ""It's Dr. Sobel"". ""He spends a lot of time with his patients"". Although that may be a good thing, it should not be at the expense of the next patient.  it is my professional opinion, that if he spends a lot of time with his patients, then they should schedule accordingly to allow room for that time, instead of making patients wait an hour and a half to be seen. 

This kind of management is totally unprofessional and unacceptable. Of note, Dr. Larry Sobel overheard my questioning, and while visiting with another patient, and said...""You can leave if you want"". I left and will not be back again.

The courtesy from his staff up front should've been, Dr. Larry is running an hour behind...and allow me the option to reschedule. However, I must say, the office had tasty snacks available for patients to enjoy while waiting.
ori_text:
I was referred to this practice by a colleague of mine. I was very excited to find a ""one stop shop"" family practice where lab and x-ray's can be done in the office, to avoid the troubles of having to go to a lab and wait for the results, then go back into the office. 

Dr. Sobel is a very personal man. I have no qualms with him. However, my first visit, Jessica, was quite rude and remained so with every visit.  Although I had a scheduled appointment, I waited in the lobby for about 30 plus mins before being walked back, only to wait another 15-20 mins before Dr. Larry would see me. 

At first I thought it was just an anomaly. However, it was like that every visit, and the office staff was not forthcoming about running behind schedule, and very unapologetic. 

Yesterday's experience took me over the edge. My appt was at 3:40p.m., I did not get called back into the office until after 4:45p.m. LITERALLY! I had checked in with ""Jessica"" a couple of times to inquire as to why it was taking so long, she said my ""chart was up there and will be called in order"", stating, ""this is Dr. Larry"".  However, I noted some people were called in earlier than I that came in later. I was finally seated in an exam room and waited until 5:14 p.m. before coming out and asking what the deal was. I asked if Dr. Sobel was being over booked or this is how late he runs all the time. They said, ""It's Dr. Sobel"". ""He spends a lot of time with his patient's"". Although that may be a good thing, it should not be at the expense of the next patient.  it is my professional opinion, that if he spends a lot of time with his patient's, then they should schedule accordingly to allow room for that time, instead of making patient's wait an hour and a half to be seen. 

This kind of management is totally unprofessional and unacceptable. Of note, Dr. Larry Sobel overheard my questioning, and while visiting with another patient, and said...""You can leave if you want"". I left and will not be back again.

The courtesy from his staff up front should've been, Dr. Larry is running an hour behind...and allow me the option to reschedule.

cf_text: Well Merc. You have let me and my friends down. I have gone to your restaurant over the years while living in the Biltmore/Arcadia area and have recommended it time and time again to people who want a 'ultra lounge feel' as opposed to a 'club like feel'. Well. After arriving for happy hour last week we had the entire Merc Bar to ourselves at about 430pm and the bartender swiftly brought us a menu and waters. Nice! However, that awesome service went downhill fast and the decibel level of the music went way up at the same rate. Soon my two friends and I were yelling our conversation to each other! That music was loud and out of character for what I 'thought' was a cool, swanky, hip, little ultra lounge. I'm thinking some jazz, maybe? Or at least some Michael Buble? At a level where your patrons can talk in a voice to each other that doesn't cause laryngitis the next day! We would eventually figure out as Merc began to fill up, that there was a group meeting here this particular day. There were so many, in fact, we could not make our way to the restroom without pushing through physically. We never saw the cocktail waitress, and that meant we never got our waters refilled after that bartender brought us our initial glass. At any rate, our drink that our once attentive bartender gave us was called the Double A. It was a mix of tequila, grapefruit juice, raspberries, lemon, and bitters. It was good! I won't deny that you have amazing fresh ingredient drinks made with premium liquors! That said, we would have stayed and ordered more, but the cocktail waitress had to be flagged down by going to the bar, and telling the bartender we wanted our bill. She came twenty minutes later and we were overcharged for our drinks. Fail. We went back to the bartender again because she kept our valet and garage tickets! We felt that trying to 'fight' over a few bucks wasn't worth the effort of the crowd, the loud music, and all of the frustration. Oh. MY. I give you a two based on your drink being unique and fresh and that is all. What you used to be, Merc Bar, I hope you can be again!

cf_text: Not much to say about C 3 gate except yuk and gross. Old looking and outdated carpeting and seating. You better have some good shoes and good wheels on your suitcase. The carpet was ripped up in places and it doesn't allow for effortless pushing. You must pull your bag if you need to get around quickly.  Really? You put a food vendor right next to the men's bathroom?? It's already tight enough trying to get in/out of the bathroom as it is with those small doorways. You have to wait and let the other person pass or you either bang into each other or your luggage will get all caught up. Stop building trams and restaurants and build better/bigger bathrooms.  Now for the coup de grace: DISGUSTING - especially since I saw a number of men who came out of the stall and didn't wash their hands. When I came out of the bathroom, two of them were standing in line to get food at California Pizza Kitchen. Really?? all I could think about was their germ/bacteria-laden hands touching napkins/utensils. Even the money that might have been used to give me change. CPK? you need the location/money that bad?  The seating areas (at least for this terminal) are few and cramped. I've never seen such self-righteous fliers who think their bag deserves a seat when other people are standing or looking for seating. Ugh.... SKY HARBOR - Epic #Fail!  Please let me know if I can help you with anything else.

cf_text: True story (and I hope someone from HBP sees this): I walk in the food story today and ask the clerk for any books about celiac disease. She gives me a blank stare like it's a new band she hasn't heard of. "It's a dietary condition where you can't eat wheat or gluten, you know that gluten-free thing?" It still doesn't register. No light bulb. I volunteer a suggestion: "The health section?" She refers me to the cookbooks. Seriously. I'm not making this up. Considering the number of restaurants that now have gluten-free options, I would recommend - other than buying some of their staff a clue - having a "celiac" book descriptor somewhere in the shelves. It's nearly impossible to find a book about celiac (and I'm pretty sure there *are* books about celiac) in HBP. Not the best place to go if you're looking for non-fiction books about celiac: lights on, but nobody home.

Despite the disappointing food, I would still consider coming back for their regular menu options.

Usually when I go to mexican restaurants they bring you chips and salsa however, they had a buffet style layout with a few extra items you don't normally see. The service was great and overall a clean establishment! I wouldn't recommend for happy hour again- too many other great restaurants in the area.

cf_text:
Meh. I'd prefer the freshness of Olive Garden's food. Staff was so-so, and the chicken parm I got on Papa's Platter was more like a miniature chicken frisbee. I could barely find the chicken, and when I did, it was hard. Overcooked? Or was it just sitting under a heat lamp for so long?

The atmosphere was just kind of dated, nothing special. I felt like I was in my grandma's basement with all the dim windows, boxes, and fake plants. 

I wouldn't really recommend this place for the food. I just wasn't impressed.

cf_text: Good food but WAY WAY overpriced. The flavors are delicious and the dishes are well-prepared. However, the portions are disappointingly small for the high prices they charge. Despite the nice staff, the decor feels old and worn out, which doesn't match with the expensive menu. If I'm going to spend a lot of money, I would rather choose one of the nice and updated restaurants in Scottsdale. ori_text: Good food but WAY WAY over priced. Small on portions, big on price! Nice staff, old worn out/tired decor. If I want to spend lots of money there are NICE and updated restaurants in Scottsdale to choose from. Being located in Cave Creek/Carefree does not give license to overcharge their patrons. Likely won't be back.

cf_text:
We were driving through town and chose this place based on other Yelp reviews and this is really the first time a highly rated dive didn't pan out for us when it comes to food.  

First the good:
- Very friendly and attentive service:  never had our water/drink glasses empty
- If you are a sports fan, they have 2 TVs and were showing different NFL games when we went there (Sunday lunchtime)
- The portions are definitely generous.

Now the average:
- The pricing really isn't that good to be honest.  For a family of 4 we paid $50 for the food and didn't order any adult beverages or appetizers.  Frankly we can pay that in Scottsdale.
- While the service was very attentive, the food took a little time to come out, and it wasn't super busy in the restaurant.  It wasn't a major flaw, but I did find myself wondering where the food was for a little while.

Now the poor:
- The food...just not good at all.  I found the refried beans to not be fresh or tasty.  Really seemed store bought to me.
- The sour cream tasted awful.  I had to scrape it off my food.
- The guacamole was mediocre at best - again seemed store bought.  My 11-year old daughter's guacamole blows this away!
- The chicken seemed very low quality...definitely dark meat.  It was seasoned fairly well, probably because of the low quality.

The decor is dated, but honestly that wasn't an issue for us.  Most of the time dives like this with high Yelp ratings have some of the best food...just not in this case.  I really like to support local businesses, but unfortunately this is not a place I'd try again when it comes to food.  Sorry.

cf_text: The welcome at Rock Springs, even though it is about the food there, is a billboard with a sexual innuendo. Strike one. This is the second time we have been here and were hoping maybe the first time was an off day. We only came for their food, specifically the pie and coffee. I had the cherry pie and my husband had the cherry crumb. Unfortunately, I could only gag down two bites. It tasted like maraschino cherries in a cornstarch gluey sauce. I know now why they call this Rock Springs because the pie crust is rock hard. There is nothing at all flaky about it. We watched the greasy food coming out of the serving window but were not impressed. Also, we saw a couple prod and poke at their hamburgers and eat very little. While we were pushing our pies around the plate and drinking our tea and coffee, we witnessed a waitress drop a fork on the floor, pick it up and throw it up on the counter near the clean coffee mugs. That did it for me. Check please. If you have never had a homemade pie and are used to store-bought ones, this might be the place for you although it's a step down. I can't see what all the rave is about. I definitely won't be back.
ori_text: The welcome at Rock Springs is a billboard with a sexual innuendo.  Strike one.  This is the second time we have been here and were hoping maybe the first time was an off day.  We only came for pie and coffee.  I had the cherry and my husband had the cherry crumb.  I could only gag down two bites.  It tasted like maraschino cherries in a cornstarch gluey sauce.  I know now why they call this Rock Springs.  The pie crust is rock hard.  Nothing at all flaky about it.  We watched the greasy food coming out of the serving window.  Also, watched a couple prod and poke at their hamburgers and eat very little.  While we were pushing our pies around the plate and drinking our tea and coffee, we watched a waitress drop a fork on the floor, pick it up and throw it up on the counter near the clean coffee mugs.  That did it for me.  Check please.  If you never had a homemade pie and are used to store bought, this might be the place for you although a step down.  I can't see what all the rave is about. Won't be back.

cf_text: Bad, bad, bad.  Moved to the Valley from Tucson and based on many yelper's comments decided to try Nando's to get our Mexican food fix.  There was a line out the door and the place was packed.  We had high hopes.  The guacamole tasted like freshly picked avocados mixed with a perfect blend of spices. The salsa had a tangy and spicy flavor that perfectly complemented the chips. The flavors reminded us of our favorite taqueria back in Tucson. The portions were generous and we couldn't resist finishing every last bite. It was a truly authentic and delicious Mexican food experience. We even brought some leftovers home for our teenage kids who thoroughly enjoyed it. We can confidently say that Nando's is the epitome of authentic Mexican cuisine and well worth the hype.
ori_text: Bad, bad, bad.  Moved to the Valley from Tucson and based on many yelper's comments decided to try Nando's to get our Mexican food fix.  There was a line out the door and the place was packed.  We had high hopes.  Guacamole tasted like something purchased in a refrigerated section of the grocery store.  Salsa tasted like tomato sauce.  Neither my husband nor I could finish the food.  Bland, not the least bit authentic and downright gross.  Took the leftovers home to my teenage kids (they usually eat everything).  They took one bite and discarded the rest...citing that Taco Bell was more authentic.  My only assumption can be that those that have yelped have never experienced authentic Mexican food.

cf_text: First, the service at this restaurant was great and secondly, I absolutely loved the food. I ordered my eggs over medium and they were cooked perfectly, just the way I like them. The toast, which is made with homemade bread daily, was outstanding as well. However, I was disappointed to find out that they didn't serve hash browns. Their excuse was that they primarily serve a business community where customers need to come and go quickly, but I didn't buy it. There were other patrons who didn't seem to be in a hurry, so their explanation doesn't make sense to me. Additionally, the ham they served was of the very thin sliced variety, not the kind of ham you usually get at breakfast. Finally, with the large milk I ordered, my bill was almost $9.00, which I found to be quite pricey considering the cheap plastic utensils they provided. The fork even broke while cutting my eggs. If they're going to use plastic utensils, they should at least invest in a medium-grade quality. Personally, I think there are much better options for breakfast in Tempe.
ori_text: First, the service was great and secondly I Like My eggs over medium & most places still bring them out over easy, not here they were cooked perfectly and the toast is made with homemade bread daily and it was outstanding. Now for the bad news, NO HASH BROWNS......They said they don't have time to cook them because they primarily service a business community where customers need to come and go quickly, interesting to me especially since there appeared to be some sort of a mens group 6 or so guys meeting there maybe a bible study and the cook (I'm assuming the owner) even came out and sat at their table for a few minutes between customers and other patrons didn't seem to be in any more of a hurry than your typical american, therefore I call BS on their no hash brown excuse. The ham they serve is of the very thin sliced variety like you would get on a sandwich, not the kind of ham you usually get when ordered at breakfast. Finally with the large milk I ordered (very good and cold by the way) my bill was almost $9.00 & for that I got to use the cheapest plastic utensils money can buy and of course the fork broke while cutting my eggs, if your going to use plastic utensils at least get a medium grade please!  Personally there are much better options in Tempe.

cf_text:
The place looks pretty legit online, but I soon found out that the food was so so so different. The place is so old and run down, but honestly, what did I expect since it was so cheap? I thought the food was pretty clean to the eye, but no one really knows what is really there.

I was pretty scared to eat there actually because I watch AMW and those creepy shows all the time and this place seemed to be the perfect place. Otherwise, the food was really bland and it seemed like everyone talking about it was just exaggerating or at least trying to make it sound better than it actually was. I was honestly scared that someone would come out of the kitchen and poison my meal, but I was too afraid to complain because then someone would know I'm unhappy and maybe do something worse?

The people at the front desk are super nice though so I feel bad writing this review, but the food could definitely use some improvements.

cf_text: Even though my dining experience was positive, I received inaccurate food on the plate. The dish stated that it had a spicy kick. It did NOT. Instead, it was bland and lacked flavor. Very disappointing!! I didn't even know that dishes could be that inaccurate.
ori_text: Even though my imaging experience was positive, I received inaccurate results on the MRI report. The report stated that I had a 60-70 % tear. I did NOT. Instead, it was found to be a 20% tear AFTER I had surgery, so it did NOT need to be repaired. Not happy with this poor reporting after all. Very disappointing!! cf_text: Location is the ONLY reason I go to this burger joint and I've been going to this location and others for the past five years. This past fall, I had gone to the restaurant after a few months hiatus. I ordered a burger and fries, and then went back to my table. It was broken into. My purse and phone were taken but not my car keys or my soda. I guess the thief must have seen what I drove. There were only 2 staff members on site, both young men - no women on staff. A police officer did come and I reported the robbery which was the 3rd in two weeks! The next day, I spoke with the manager. The same speech he's probably told others, you can tell the bottom line is the only thing he cares about. I lost everything plus a $100 bill which was my b-day money and I've spent over a few grand for meals. I did receive a refund for 3 meals but still REALLY! 'Well you shouldn't leave stuff at the table. These people go from restaurant to restaurant. We have signs that tell you not to leave items at the table"... ummm it was my table and I've been coming here for over four years and have never had an issue until now. If you are having robberies, you NEED to tell people not just a sign! Plus one of the staff told me they were having major issues this past fall... umm that's not someone from the outside that's a staff member doing the robberies! I found out last week there were MORE robberies! So if you are looking for a restaurant, move on and go somewhere else. It's not the cleanest restaurant but I like their sauces and that's about it! And then I get a call that they found my purse and calendar at a table. The manager never followed up with me and when I got my items they were stuffed in a drawer and the staff member didn't even seem to care. I think it's time for a new staff and management!

cf_text: I go to fast food places a few times a year, at best, so maybe my expectations are a little skewed, but my latest experience at McDonald's left a lot to be desired. There's really no use in rating the actual food, as it's hard to screw up food at a McDonald's. It's all subpar grub, but my penchant for getting filet-o-fish sandwiches this time of year lives on anyway, so I had to go satiate my once-a-year craving.  My issue was with the service. I walked in and the employees were just chatting it up with their friends and off-hours coworkers who were on the customer side of the counter. It was around 11pm and the lack of customers inside of the restaurant made it pretty obvious that I was the only person waiting for my food order to be taken, but that didn't stop the employees behind the counter from finishing their conversations before taking my order.  After I finally put my order in, I seemed to wait an eternity (in fast food terms) for my two filet-o-fish sandwiches, regular McBites, and medium french fry order. It was hardly a complicated food order, but I've waited less time during peak hours at other fast food chains in the past. Thankfully, there was ONE girl working who saw me standing there for a long time, and asked, "are his McBites up yet?...where are they?" I was happy that someone had finally addressed the situation, but it shouldn't have taken that long.  Again, I'm aware that showing up at 11pm will probably increase my odds of walking into a late-night, preparing-for-the-next-day mess of a restaurant, but even in fast food, it's absurd to think that the level of cleanliness that I walked into is acceptable. Not to mention, the one girl who was working announcing that she was "going to pee" while I was standing there. I wasn't offended at all, but I found it odd that she thought that was acceptable to say in front of a customer.  I guess this experience reminded me of why I limit my trips to fast food chains as much as possible, especially when it comes to the food.

cf_text: The food and service at this Denny's is lousy. First, it took a while to get a waiter to take our order. Then, he was slow with serving our drinks. After that, he was really slow with bringing out our food and never came by to refill our drinks. To make matters worse, they completely forgot part of my order and mixed up my friends' orders. We never even received our check, so we had to go up to the cashier to sort it out. By the time we finally got in the car, I realized we had wasted an hour and 45 minutes at this restaurant! Unless you want to waste time, I would advise against going to this Denny's.

cf_text: I will never understand why this packed restaurant has such a reputation for its food. The steaks, while lean, are never cooked to my liking. And don't even get me started on their pulled pork sandwich, which comes out dry without any sauce whatsoever. It seems like they have an excessive use of salt in their dishes. The fries are so heavily salted that you have to search for any hint of potato flavor. And let's not forget about the peanut shells on the floor, which only adds to the overall uncleanliness of this place. Although the rolls are flavorful, they tend to be on the harder side. The only redeeming factor is their sweet tea, which I must admit is quite good. If you choose to eat here, proceed with caution. Oh, and be prepared to scream across the table if you want to be heard over the obnoxiously loud Happy Birthday singing every few minutes by the wait staff.
ori_text: I will never understand why this place is always packed? The steaks although lean are never cooked the way you ask them to be. The pulled pork sandwich comes dry (no sauce what so ever). I also think they use more salt then any other eatery I have gone to. You shouldn't have so much salt on the fries that you have to search for signs of potato. I understand people get a kick out of throwing the peanut shells on the floor and all, but it also makes this one of the dirtiest restaurants around. Yes the rolls are flavorful, but tend to be on the hard side. One of my two stars go to their sweet tea. If you pick this place to eat give it a try. \n\nOn a side note the wait staff tends to sing Happy Birthday at the top of their lungs every five minutes. Be ready to scream to the person at your table if you want to be heard.

cf_text: I think this is my last time coming to YC's for food. I used to love it and went frequently, but in the last few years, the price has gone up and the taste isn't all that great. The buffet allows us to create our own food, but I didn't vary much in my selections, including sauces. Yesterday, I was shocked by the price, it was $11.50 and I had just arrived during dinner time. Not only that, but the bowls they provided were smaller and couldn't fit all the food I wanted. On the other hand, the bowls they used for cooked food were much larger and hardly filled up. It's disappointing considering the price I paid. Moreover, the experience was ruined by a group of young employees sitting behind me who were loud and used foul language. I had to move to the other side of the restaurant to escape it. It was unprofessional and not what I expected. Lastly, when I was leaving, I was surprised that they charged extra for a box to take the leftover food home. I've given YC's a fair chance, but I don't like what it has become. There is a different mongolian place that just opened near my house that I will probably try next time I'm in the mood for this cuisine. Sorry YC's, but this is the end of our food relationship.
ori_text:
I think this is my last time coming here.  I used to love YC's and went frequently.  In the last few years I have been put off by the price and it just seems like the taste isn't all that great.  Granted we create our own food through the buffet but I don't think I varied a great deal on my selections, including sauces.  

I went yesterday and first of all was totally put off by the price!  11.50?!?!?  It's been creeping up there but this was outrageous and I think I was literally 5 min into the ""dinner time"" (after 5p).  After that the first thing I noticed was the bowls were smaller (smaller metal bowls).  I was trying to cut back but by the time I was done with veggies and meat my bowl was overflowing.  Then I noticed that the bowls they put the cooked food in were much larger.  I'm not trying to feed the block but for 11.50 I should get a bowl that will fit the food I want (the cooked food didn't fill the large bowl at all).  Or maybe be allowed to use a second bowl for the noodles or something. 

I ended up sitting in one of the booths along the wall.  Unfortunately a group of their young employees (my guess was they were teenagers, maybe young 20's) sat behind me and were goofing off, loud and had some really foul language.  I ended up having to move to the other side of the restaurant.  There were only 3 other groups of people in the place and they had to sit by customers?  Very unprofessional. I understand there was downtime but no one ever wants F-this or F-that as their soundtrack especially when it is coming from the employees of the establishment. 

Finally I went to leave and I while I hoped that the price of the food for dinner would include a box, not so much.  So another $0.50 for that (I've always really hated that they charge for this, especially knowing the high chances of people needing to take home the food).  

I've given the place a shot but I don't like what it's become and there is a different mongolian place that just opened by my house that I will probably try the next time I get in the mood for it.  Sorry YC's this is the end of our relationship. :(

cf_text: Somewhere along the line, this place went from a fun distraction with a light-hearted style and passable food to a place that I avoid at all costs. The last time I was there, the bathrooms were so disgusting I had to walk next door to use their bathrooms instead. Just dirty toilets, paper towels strewn everywhere. In addition, pretty much every table in the place still had people's finished meals on them. Nobody was cleaning up the place! Our food was barely edible, lacking any flavor or appeal. The fried pickles were soggy and tasteless, and my burger was so overdone I only finished about half of it. I'm sorry guys -- I hate to write a bad review but there's really no choice here. Stay away from this restaurant until they fix their issues with the food.

We have mostly had good experiences with the food here but last night was so awful so here's my review. 

Two $7 margaritas and I walked out completely sober. (Tried two different ones even!) The food concept in this statement is the margaritas, which are a type of beverage typically served in bars or restaurants.

The waitress, Amber, tried to explain to me some frat bullshit she was told about having a drink that was cold, sweet, and sour and how you therefore don't taste the alcohol. I am usually toast after a half of one of the Top Shelf margaritas...and no joke, I could have passed any field sobriety test.

She was an awful waitress to begin with - although not intentionally - she just seemed to be way over her head and have some sort of short term memory problem.

She did however do what she could to make sure we left barely happy - but still charging me for $7 margaritas that I disliked was crap.

We are done with that place and that will be absolutely the last time we go back.

cf_text: I came here with a group of 12 on Saturday morning for breakfast. We all arrived at separate times and agreed that the signs directing you to the restaurant were confusing. All of us got lost, but the detours enabled us to tour the beautiful resort. The Pointe Tapatio is gorgeous, wonderful cliffs, great design... Now if only the restaurant could improve..  Once we were all seated we waited (and waited and waited) to order. The server appeared to take our drink order, perhaps not realizing we had been sitting there for over half an hour and were prepared to order food as well. When he finally returned we were salivating hyenas, yet still more than half the table were unhappy with the meal placed before them.  While we waited an eternity for our food to arrive I looked around the restaurant and noticed how dirty it was. There were 3 separate tables where it looked as though they spilled a pitcher of ice on the floor and didn't bother cleaning it up. We actually saw a busser carrying a tray full of glasses with OJ spilling all over the floor, we called it out to our server but he was nonplussed and took no action.  On to the food: My personal experience was the best. I ordered an egg, ham, and cheese bagel, they brought it out cold with the cheese unmelted. I asked the waiter to have the cooks throw it under the broiler, he rolled his eyes and took my plate. When he brought it back it was still cold and instead of melting the cheese they removed it.. Message here.. If you complain "No cheese for you!" At this point my party had finished eating so I ate the cold $12 bagel.  Pointe in Thyme was a major bummer when it came to the food and very overpriced, I will not return nor recommend it to others. The restaurant seriously needs to improve in terms of cleanliness, service, and food quality.

cf_text:
If you're in search of good food, keep driving.  
If you're in search of delicious pie, drive to the Pie Hole in Phoenix.  

I used to go to Rock Springs Cafe on a monthly basis with my grandparents when I was younger.  That was our thing - taking a Sunday drive and stopping by RSC on our way back home to grab amazing food and a piece of  ""Penny's Pies"".   Penny was the gal that used to make all the incredible pies in Black Canyon City.  I learned while we were waiting for our table that there are new owners, and oh my how things have changed.  From the appearance and layout to more importantly - the quality of the food.   

Keep on drivin' if you're hungry and in this neck of the woods.  J, Baby C, and I stopped by Rock Springs to get an early supper on Sunday after a day trip up north.  I told him about how good the pies were and the food was in general.  He was on board when it came time to figure out what we were doing for supper.   

J ordered the mouth-watering meatloaf dinner and I ordered the scrumptious chicken.  Our plan was to feed Baby C off of both our plates.  Good idea in theory.  When we ordered, I stated I wanted a baked potato (which was on the menu) and the gal said that they don't serve baked potatoes until after 5pm.  Ummm...Its Sunday and a holiday weekend.  If one was going to sell a baked potato, 4pm on a Sunday would be the right time.  No where on the menu did it state that baked potatoes weren't available until after 5pm.  

J gets the luscious soup (chowder) and I get a satisfying side salad.  You really cant screw up either of those.  J said his soup was pretty good.  

Our dinner comes out a few minutes later.  We were shocked to say the least.  We both dig in and J immediately is repulsed.  His meatloaf was lukewarm, greasy, and the gravy on top was congealed.  GAG.  My chicken was more like a Cornish game hen.  See photo for the worlds smallest chicken leg.  It looked more like a drumette, you know, the kind you'd get with an order of chicken wings.  The vegetables that came with our dinners, a half ear of waterlogged field corn.  An ear of corn (a bad ear at that) hardly constitutes as ""vegetables"".  I was thinking we'd get green beans, peas, carrots, or something.  

The waitress came by and saw J was not pleased.  So she took his plate and asked if he wanted anything else. I told him to skip the regular food and to just get a piece of pie.  If he was hungry, we could get him something at the outlets in Anthem (which was where we were stopping by on our way home).  J liked this idea and ordered a slice of heavenly banana cream pie.  

When the pie came out, he took a few bites and that was it.  He said it tasted like real banana and was not cold, but slightly warm.  I seriously doubt this was a true ""Penny's Pie"".  More like a bad knockoff.    

The only positive thing out of the whole trip was the waitress took his dinner and pie off our bill, without us having to ask or talk to a manager.  

We stopped by the general store, but the guy there didn't seem interested in helping us.  Or at least helping me.  But yet he yacked it up with J for a minute.  When I walked over to the counter to try a sample he was pushing J, did he acknowledge me?  Nope.  So we left.

And we wont be returning.  If we're out for a drive, and are in need of amazing food...we'll drive to Anthem.  

And - If you really want a GOOD (more like AWESOME) piece of homemade pie, go to The Pie Hole in Phoenix.  :)

cf_text: Carmax lacks the integrity and reasonable fairness of a well-prepared meal. I brought my vehicle in with $2000 worth of front suspension repairs needed, expecting a fair appraisal. However, to my disappointment, I was only offered $4000. Determined to get a better deal, I took my vehicle to the dealership and repaired the suspension, thinking it would increase its value. When I returned to Carmax, the representative who initially gave me the appraisal suggested that the repairs would indeed make a difference. So, I went ahead and spent the $2000, believing it would be worth it. However, the second representative at Carmax still only offered me the same $4000. This lack of consistency and fairness in their appraisal process is like serving a plate of food that looks good but lacks any real flavor. It's a complete letdown. They missed important details like the fact I was missing a driver's door mirror, and even after replacing it, it had no positive impact on their offer. It feels like I was taken advantage of during these challenging times. My vehicle was worth more, and I could have saved $2000 by not repairing it based on false promises from Carmax. This is simply not acceptable.
ori_text: Carmax lacks integrity and reasonable fairness when buying/appraising your car. i brought my vehicle in with $2000 in front suspension repair needed. i was appraised $4000. i then 3 days later took my vehicle to the dealership and repaired the suspension to get more for my vehicle. so i returned to carmax, my representative who initially gave me an appraisal price for my vehicle suggested that it would increase the value of my vehicle if i were to do the repairs. He also suggested that my vehicle will be going straight to auction in its condition. so have thought things through and figured who wants to buy a car that needed repair, so i repaired it. i returned to carmax with the same vehicle only now fully repaired by the dealer and having spent $2000 only for the second representative to offer me the same amount of $4000. this make absolutely no sense. wheres the level of integrity in your appraisal process. the first quote was missed the fact that i was missing a drivers door mirror and the second quote there was no positive impact from replacing the drivers door mirror or any repairs. so did i get taken advantage of because of these pressing times.....i believe yes. My vehicle was worth more and if not i could have save $2000 in repairing my vehicle under the impression that carmax would offer me more at appraisal. NOT GOOD!!

cf_text: Seriously the worst interaction with owner at a restaurant. I am on vacation and decide to go out for dinner. Halfway through my meal, I realize that I left my credit card holder where I was staying. I ask 2 of the waiters to check my purse since my hands are messy. Neither of them found it. I immediately tell my waiter who ignores me. Then the manager calls the owner to tell him I won't pay. The owner begins to accuse me of intentionally going in there to steal their services and not pay. He wants me to leave my phone while I go get money. He keeps yelling that I'm lying. Mind you, I have money on the table. I call a friend who is on her way over to pay. Meanwhile, the owner calls the police. The police listen to him rant and then point out that if I was intentionally planning to rip them off, I would not be sitting inside calmly eating. The owner keeps saying "She's lying." The cop said, "I can't do anything about it. She can leave now without paying and you can't do anything." My friend came, paid, and we went to the movies. At least I have a great vacation story. When I visit again, I will find a new restaurant. Overpriced and zero customer service. Truly the worst place ever.

She made eye contact with us when we walked in and just resumed her conversation with the person she was talking to (who was not even ordering anything). Finally, after waiting for a while, she did come over and take our food order.  The temperature in the restaurant was really uncomfortably warm, especially for it being Phoenix in May. The bathrooms are also very small and cramped, with no real doors on the stalls. Overall, I can honestly say that I will not be returning to this place for their food.

cf_text: I was in the mood for some catfish, so I decided to try the 12 East Cafe on Jefferson. Unfortunately, they apparently close at 3:00pm. There I was, right between Mrs. White's to the West and Mandy's Fish and Chips to the East. I hopped on the train and got off at the next stop east, and sure enough, there was Mandy's, "right there." The building looked like a second hand fast food joint. The parking lot was completely empty, and the door facing the metro rail was locked. the drive-thru sign was on, but the open sign was off. I decided to try another door, and it was unlocked. It turns out that they had just forgotten to turn the sign on!  The inside was Spartan, but clean. At the counter, I ordered the fish and chicken combo plate with a soda, and I asked to substitute hush-puppies for the fries. The total came to $12.00 even. The food was brought to me in about 4-5 min.  The fish was pretty good, moist inside with a really nice, light corn batter. The chicken strips, however, were on the dry side, but that's why God made spicy dipping sauce. The hush-puppies, on the other hand, were beyond saving. These dense, little, undercooked, bland lumps were truly the worst hush-puppies I have ever eaten. This may sound like a joke, but Long John Silver's hush-puppies are way better.  Overall, it's a nice, little fish and chips place. If I try it again I'll get fries or onion rings if they have them. The locked door I encountered when I first approached the building was actually being looked at by a locksmith as I was leaving, so that at least has been fixed.

Even though the food service has tended to be slow and rather inattentive in the past, we have never experienced this level of rudeness with the food before. We will not be back.

cf_text: Fast food service (1 1/2 weeks), did not do what I requested with my sandwich, sloppy cosmetic work.   I really wanted to write a glowing review. I ordered a cheeseburger from Burger Delight some months ago. That was a pretty good experience.  I asked to have pickles and onions added to my burger. The pickles and onions require slicing and dicing. The bun has to be cut back to fit the toppings. Not an easy customization, but that's why I took it to an experienced fast food joint.  Fast food enthusiasts recommend adding ketchup to enhance the flavor. I asked for that but it did not happen. A note on the order ticket said "Don't know about the ketchup." A call to discuss would have worked. The cashier said if ketchup had been necessary, they would have used it. Sorry I'm so stupid, but I asked for the service and intended to pay for it. It may not matter. Guess I will find out. The pickles and onions are a little off center. I was able to use the napkin to correct for the slight misplacement.  Ketchup streaks on the side of the bun is sloppy but only cosmetic. Two stars for doing a fast custom order. Poor communication and not doing the job as requested is a problem.
ori_text:
Fast gunsmith service (1 1/2 weeks), did not do what I requested, sloppy cosmetic work.  

I really wanted to write a glowing review.  I bought a 12 gauge shotgun from Guns Etc. for 3 gun competition some months ago.  That was a pretty good experience.  

I asked to have ghost ring sights installed.  The rear sight requires drilling and tapping the receiver.  The barrel rib has to be cut back to mount the front sight.  Not an easy install, but that's why I took it to an experienced gunsmith.  

Gun forums recommend adding a cross pin to secure the front sight to augment the epoxy provided by the mfg.  I asked for that but it did not happen.  A note on the service ticket said ""Don't know about the pin.""  A call to discuss would have worked.  The clerk said if a pin had been necessary the gunsmith would have used one.  Sorry I'm so stupid, but I asked for the service and intended to pay for it.  It may not matter.  Guess I will find out.  The front sight is rotated a little off center.  I was able to use the rear sight adjustment to correct for the slight misalignment.

Epoxy streaks on the side of the front sight is sloppy but only cosmetic.  Two stars for doing a fast install.  Poor communication and not doing the job as requested is a problem.

I felt like our waiter was up selling us the whole time and the hovering cocky owner was annoying at best. and lets talk about the "As seen on food network" sign hanging over the door and the diner guys pic hanging ever where, way overkill there. also what happened to a basket of free food bread, come on $3 for bread are you kidding me. Whatever this place can suck it I wont be back.

cf_text:
I'm really trying to figure out all the five-star food reviews from this place. It smelled like delicious food when I walked in and ordered my meal. But I was surprised the lady taking my food order spoke Spanish and not a word of English... in Panda Express?!

The napkins were empty, and the Spanish-speaking lady watched me as I discovered no napkins. I had to ask her to refill them. I also had to ask someone to clean the tables as there was not a clean table in the place. The lady wet the seat so much I had to stand and hold my food while it dried.

I'm afraid to eat my food. What does the kitchen look like if the dining area hasn't been cleaned? Now a baby is screaming. I will not be back.

cf_text: Alright, I've got the same hangup most others have about this place. The food isn't just good, it's downright delicious. They give you a generous portion for a great price. Don't expect authentic Chinese cuisine, this is American Chinese food - just like most Chinese restaurants in this country.  Now here's the hangup I have with Taipei South. The customer service is lacking, especially in regards to the food. The ladies that work the front aren't mean people at all, so let me make that clear. But the service can be hit or miss. Sometimes orders are quickly taken, drinks are always refilled promptly, and the food comes out in a timely manner. However, other times it can be the complete opposite. I'll use my last visit as an example:  The waitresses hardly said anything (which is the usual case). They did bring out a little jar of Dr Pepper so I could refill my cup faster, but at one point, a waitress came by and took the jar to refill another customer's drink without even realizing that I had been using it... Then she put it back on my table. Additionally, even though it was past the peak lunch hour (1:45 pm and only 1/3 full), I had to wait 12 minutes from the time I got my check to when I received the receipt.  This place really needs to work on their hospitality. It would make a world of difference. Maybe they're satisfied with where they're at, since they serve such delicious food. However, it's no secret that friendly and memorable service creates an unforgettable experience for the customer, something that keeps them coming back. I would love for Taipei South to figure this out.

cf_text: I bought a Kitchen Aid Mixer on December 6th at the Kitchen Collection Store at the Outlet Mall in Carlsbad, CA, but when my son and his wife opened it on Christmas, it made grinding noises as the beaters turned. I contacted the store in Carlsbad and they advised me to take it to any of the Arizona stores with the receipt. So my son and his family made a trip to the Kitchen Collection store at Anthem, but they had a very unpleasant experience there. Despite presenting the mixer in its box, with all the accessories and the receipt, they were told that the store does not accept returns or exchanges on Kitchen Aid appliances. My son showed them the policy on the receipt, but they claimed it was an unwritten policy. The staff was not helpful or friendly, and my son had to leave with the faulty mixer. He called Kitchen Aid's customer service and they will be sending him a new one. It's a disappointing experience, especially considering the money I could have saved with a rebate was spent on the gas for this trip.
ori_text: I bought a Kitchen Aid Mixer on December 6th at the Kitchen Collection Store at the Outlet Mall in Carlsbad, CA.  It was given to my son and his wife for Christmas.  When they got it out of the (NEW) box to use it, as the beaters turned, it made grinding noises.  I called the KC in Carlsbad and explained what happened and that my son lives in Phoenix.  They said to take it in with the receipt to any of the Arizona KC stores.  My son and his wife and baby took a 40 mile trip to go to the Kitchen Collection store at Anthem.  The experience they had was way less than pleasant. \nAfter lugging the Mixer in and presenting it (in the box with everything it came with) and the receipt to the person workiing at their register, my son was told that they don't take returns or exchanges on the kitchen aid items.  My son told her what I had been told and also showed her on the bottom of the receipt that stated they DO accept returns and exchanges and she told him it was Company Policy not to do so on Kitchen Aid appliances.  He asked if she had that policy in writing and she said \""NO, it is an understood policy and is not in writing.\"" After trying to talk with her and ask to speak with someone else, she was still rude.  They were not nice and not helpful and did not follow the policy stated on their receipt.  My son left with his Kitchen Aid Mixer, went home, called Kitchen Aid's 800 number and they are sending him a new one.  Sad experience and  the money I would have saved with a rebate, was spent on gas.

cf_text: After my same-sex date and I sat down at the bar, it took more than 10 minutes (I was watching the clock) before the waiter first addressed us and only AFTER serving an opposite-sex couple who had sat down next to us FIVE minutes later.  I was very disappointed that we weren't served in the order in which we arrived.  We had gone to Pizzera Bianco the previous weekend and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of the dining experience.  So, we had similarly high expectations for the Pane Bianco cafe.  We were disappointed.  If we weren't starving, we would've gone elsewhere.  We're not entirely sure that the unsatisfactory service was the result of our sexual orientation, but it was very suspicious. The food, however, was delicious, and we are certain that we will think twice before going to any more of the Bianco's restaurants.

Again, nice but you can tell that the building is old and could use some renovations.   When we looked it up on a few of our favorite travel sites it had good reviews which is also why I am torn it was nice but not as nice as it looks.   Just a heads up!!

I would never go back to those apartments and I would never recommend them.

cf_text: Epic food failure! I needed two cheeseburgers and they were running a BOGO sale. Score, or so I thought. They had one cheeseburger in stock and promised the other one a few days later. I went to pick up the first cheeseburger and it was cooked as promised. The cashier handed it to me to try and walked me to a table. It tasted fine but then she got busy helping somebody else (they work on commission) and I was promptly blown off. I found another employee who wrapped up my purchase and double checked that my second cheeseburger was indeed ordered. He assured me that it would be there on Monday and not to worry. I got busy and called on Wednesday to find out that my second cheeseburger was still not there. They promised that they would have the cheeseburger tomorrow morning but I'm not holding my breath. Half priced cheeseburgers shouldn't come with half service. I hate posting negative food reviews but this type of customer service is becoming the norm. It turns George Zimmer into a liar and he didn't even sell me the cheeseburger.
