cf_text:
We headed to the strip district to soak in the atmosphere like any good tourist should do.

Unfortunately we love to sleep and showed up a little late and by the time we were ready to eat (around 4pm) our list of recommended food places to try were already closed for the day. 

Roland's was open though. As an added bonus they were showing the Steeler's game and there is nothing that Pittsburgh loves more than supporting the Steeler's and Penguin's. The atmosphere was great with everyone dressed in black and yellow and really into the game.

We ordered the famous local dish, pierogies (pretty delicious) and the Primanti Bros sandwich. Maybe our mistake was not ordering the local delicacy, the Primanti Bros sandwich, anyway the french fries on it were actually cooked in oil (eww) and the coleslaw itself was just as creamy. It felt like we were eating comfort food.

As for the waitstaff, Pittsburgh in general has some of the friendliest people I've come across in a long time. The waitstaff here may not have been quite as friendly as we had come to expect from the rest of this lovely city but they were just fine.

We headed to the strip district to soak in the atmosphere like any good tourist should do.

Unfortunately we love to sleep and showed up a little late and by the time we were ready to eat (around 4pm) our list of recommended places to try were already closed for the day.

We ordered wedding soup (pretty delicious) and Portobello Mushroom Pizza. Maybe our mistake was not ordering seafood, anyway the caramelized onions on it were actually cooked in sugar (eww) and the sauce itself was just as sweet. It felt like we were eating candy.

As for the staff, Pittsburgh in general has some of the friendliest people I've come across in a long time. The staff here may not have been quite as friendly as we had come to expect from the rest of this lovely city but they were just fine.

cf_text:
Normally I never visit chains as I detest them, but on a Sunday night Mother's Day, there really was nowhere else to go. It was either between this place and Red Devil and I wish we just would have went to Red Devil instead. They do not take reservations but we were pleasantly surprised to find that the wait was non-existent on this night and we were seated right away.

The waiter took our drink orders and my sister was the only one that didn't want lemon in her drink and he was kinda rude about that, something about making his job more difficult or something but whatever. The menu is huge and they have a Skinnylicious menu that features light menu items if you are watching your weight. 

Pretty much anything that you could want is on the menu; italian, asian, american, etc. and let's not forget that cheesecake! The cheesecake is the one item where you cannot go wrong. OMG Red Velvet layer cheesecake is 7.95 a slice as they are all aptly priced but it is a huge slice enough for two people. The mango passion tea is great as were their mixed drinks which are $9.25++. The veggie burger I ordered was okay, with nothing groundbreaking in flavor or toppings, sauces etc. The fries were a bit disappointing and the food presentation was pretty lackluster. However, their cheesecake is a must-try. On the downside, my mom ordered a turkey burger that was incredibly greasy and she was not happy with it. She asked the waiter if he was sure if it was a turkey burger and he assured her it was, but unfortunately, he did not get her something else or offer to take it off of the bill. So, the food experience was somewhat disappointing considering this was Mother's Day and I wanted my mom to at least enjoy her meal.

Overall, the food was so-so, varying on a variable basis. The service, on the other hand, was abysmal. We never even got our water glasses refilled, and another waitress even stepped on my sister's foot but refused to move in a timely manner. I'm going to have to pass on this one unless I need cheesecake in the near future. The validated parking is free with a two-hour limit.

cf_text: Ugh! I think I am going to be sick! Please let the record reflect that I did not choose this restaurant. It was chosen as a meeting place by my sister-in-law sight unseen. Located in kind of a dingy strip mall, the place was pretty full on a Sunday night. We took this as a good sign. The staff was friendly and was very good about bringing drink refills and clearing plates. The restaurant was relatively clean.   Let's get down to the heart of eating out, though, which is FOOD. The food ranged from unexceptional to bad. The eggrolls, jalapeno chicken, and fried wantons were not bad, but nothing special. The coconut shrimp, however, was the best thing I ate and was actually tasty, with a perfect balance of flavors. The hot and sour soup was okay, not the best I've had but still decent.  Do not be tempted by the sushi. I am skeptical anytime I see sushi at a buffet, but decided to try it anyway. It was TERRIBLE! The one nigiri I had was just awful. The fish was not fresh and the rice was bland. The one California type roll was similarly AWFUL. I hope that sushi virgins are not getting this as their first taste of sushi, because it will turn them off to sushi forever.   The other items to choose from were standard Chinese buffet fare, but bland and greasy. Nothing special here. I was too afraid to try very much, as the overall quality of the food was disappointing.   After eating at Great Wall Buffet, I feel cheap and dirty, but I did not even enjoy the experience. If I am going to be so bad, it should at least be worth it.

cf_text:
I was fooled by the reviews. This was my first time ever going to a food truck, and from the reviews, this placed seems like they would help me figure it out. 
Well, I took my comforter in to wash today and the lady working was overly rude when I asked her questions about the food options. And if I didn't catch it the first time, she started speaking to me in a slow, degrading manner. She also told me I needed the biggest, most expensive meal on the menu, which was probably actually a little excessive, but oh well. 
Also, well over half of the food trucks are out of order. And the place isn't very clean for a food truck park. 
Maybe I just didn't come when the right employees were working, but these other reviews had my expectations a lot higher than they should have been.

cf_text: Terrible customer service. I felt like I was eating at a fast food restaurant rather than dining at a fine establishment. Was denied the option to return items out of return window, just like being denied a delicious meal. It was easily taken back and reimbursed at an alternate location, just like how a well-cooked dish can be enjoyed at a different restaurant. Was not allowed to talk to a manager when requested, leaving me with a bad taste in my mouth. Disappointed this represents the LOFTs brand, as I had high expectations for a satisfying dining experience.
ori_text: Terrible customer service. Was denied the option to return items out of return window that was easily taken back and reimbursed at an alternate location. Was not allowed to talk to a manager when requested.  Disappointed this represents the LOFTs brand.

cf_text: I ordered a taco from Dee's. I was starting a new dance class and was excited about it! I was a little concerned about my final selection because of an injury, but the saleswoman assured me I could exchange it if it wasn't too worn. I ate the taco once and it was just too spicy for me. When I went in to exchange it for a milder option, I was told they wouldn't exchange it once it was eaten. This surprised me. So, I talked to Jamie, the owner or manager, who said she would check things out with her employee and call me back that day, but based on her employee's notes, I had been notified of their no return, no exchange once eaten policy. I didn't receive a call back that day or the next. Even if this is their policy, it wasn't clearly explained, and they didn't follow up. Now I have a taco I can't eat and need to buy another one. I won't be buying it there. It's so short sighted. This taco probably cost them $2 wholesale. Was that worth losing my goodwill and a bad YELP review?
ori_text: I bought a pair of shoes from Dee's. I was starting a new dance class and was excited about it! I was a little concerned about my final selection because of an injury, but the saleswoman assured me I could exchange them if they weren't too worn. This surprised me. So, I talked to Jamie, the owner or manager, who said she would check things out with her employee and call me back that day, but based on her employee's notes, I had been notified of their no return, no exchange once worn policy. Now I have a pair of shoes I can't wear and need to buy another pair. I won't be buying them there. It's so short sighted. These shoes probably cost them $20 wholesale. Was that worth losing my goodwill and a bad YELP review?

cf_text: We got there and told them we had a party of 8 but wouldn't seat us until all 8 arrived or even take our name down. When the other 4 arrived they wanted to seat us separate like opposite sides of the restaurant. Told us 15 to 30 minutes and seated people they arrived AFTER us BEFORE us. After 40 minutes. We said something. Got us two tables not together. Finally. If it wasn't for our server and the delicious food, it would have been horrible. Very disorganized and hostess couldn't even do their job. Won't come back. Only reason it actually got one star was due to the server and the amazing food.

cf_text: Stop by this AM for some delicious food, including coffee and a sandwich. The food is decent, but it could use some improvement in terms of presentation. While the service could have been better and the prices lower, you can still save money and enjoy a similar meal by going to the restaurant across the street, where you can save $4.00 on the same food items.

cf_text: BEWARE!! Don't park your car here while traveling. We returned from a 10-day trip and loaded the car and started the engine. Loud exhaust noise. Car catalyst vandalized (cut out) in the parking lot that supposedly has security. The only security person we saw was on the day we returned and he was hanging out in the lobby. Hotel staff and the bus driver said this has happened numerous times. General manager provided me with their insurance info as a way to get me out of the lobby, knowing that their insurance company was not going to cover vandalism damage to our car. $2200.00 later, the car is fixed. The situation was handled very poorly by Hampton Inn management, just like the food quality at this hotel.

cf_text: The food is great. The fries are nice and the burgers are just ho hum. I don't get why everyone praises this place. It's a bit high priced for what you get. The servers are nice. And they don't have any fat chicks, that's a plus.

cf_text: Not too shabby. I would call it a "finer diner" in terms of the definition of a Diner. The menu has your everyday American food items; nothing too creative or imaginative. It's pretty basic. Salads, sandwiches, burgers, and entrees we have all had before. The food is good though; however, you're paying for the location and decor (which, in our opinion, was kind of out-dated). We started with the mushroom flatbread, which was a bit on the sweet side, but it was loaded with mushrooms, which is a huge plus. The burger I ordered was juicy and perfectly cooked, and the fries were crispy and delicious. All in all, I guess this is where the rich people of ShadySide get their diner food: same kind of food, just a fancier ambiance than Denny's. We will be back when we want something comforting but don't want to be surrounded by teenagers and want something better than Eat 'N Park.
ori_text:
Not too shabby.  I would call it a ""finer diner"" in terms of the definition of a Diner.  The menu has your everyday American items; nothing too creative or imaginative.   It's pretty basic.  Salads, sandwiches, burgers and entrees we have all had before.
The food is good though; however you're paying for the location and decor (which, in our opinion, was kind of out-dated).  We started with the mushroom flatbread that was a bit on the sweet side; however it was loaded with mushrooms which is a huge plus.
I had the walnut crusted salmon sandwich and Jordan had the reuben.  The salmon was very light and tasty and Jordan's corned beef was sliced real thick.  French fries are pretty standard.
All in all, I guess this is where the rich people of ShadySide get their diner food: same kind of food, just a fancier ambiance than Denny's.  
We will be back when we want something comforting but dont want to be surrounded by teenagers and want something better than Eat 'N Park.

cf_text: We used to stay here as a jeep club some years ago and really enjoyed the food. Times have changed. An investment group has taken over and the friendly atmosphere is missing, including the delicious meals that were once served. Now, the food options are limited and lack the quality we used to enjoy. Wifi is non-existent unless you are in the office. Signs of aging are present throughout the property, and the staff is not very friendly.

cf_text: Terrible! I got a haircut here once and hated it, but kept waiting for it to settle in after a few washes. It never did look right, so I just fixed it at home rather than going back to these incompetent people. I didn't even feel like the hassle of complaining was worth it, as I highly doubted that I'd get any money refunded and I certainly didn't want them to touch my hair again to try to fix it.   I then figured, hey, this place sucks for haircuts but they can't mess up eyebrow waxing, right? Right! But their service is so bad that I gave up on that too -- I got my eyebrows done here a few times with not much trouble, but the last time I went in, I had called ahead to put my name in and was told that I would be next on the list, and to show up in about 20 min. My house is a 20 min walk from there, perfect! I headed out, got there in 20 min, and gave the woman at the desk my name and reminded her I'd called ahead. There was one man sitting there waiting, who I had seen from across the street walking in about 1 min ahead of me.   The stylist was just finishing up a haircut, so I should have been next, right, since I had put my name in before the guy who walked in? Nope! She called him over and I said "sorry, I think I was next, I called ahead and was told I'd be next in line" and the lady said "oh we don't do that." WTF?? You told me very clearly that you do exactly that, what craziness is this? So I waited, figuring that I'd already invested 20 min into this venture, so I may as well stick it out.   And waited, and waited, while one stylist cut the man's hair and 2 of them chatted in the back (ironically next to the chair where they do facial waxing). They must have been "on break," or maybe just terribly rude and idiotic, because I sat there waiting for another full 20 min, and when I finally spoke up again to ask when someone would be available to do my eyebrows. The 2 chatty cathies in the back looked over, very annoyed at my presence, and the woman doing the haircut said "after I'm done here," and I sat there incredulous for another 2 minutes before getting up and leaving. Will never go back. The service at this place is worse than the food at a bad restaurant.

cf_text: I want to establish something before I review my dining experience at Chili's: the food is terrible. No matter how great the waitstaff, chefs, managers, or dishwashers are, it cannot change the fact that the food is bad.   So, people of Chili's, I salute your service and appreciate everything you tried to do. The staff is friendly, helpful, quick, efficient, and wonderful.   But when it comes to the food, it's a different story. The chips and salsa are bad. They taste like the least appealing salsa and chips from a grocery store.   And if the chips and salsa are bad, how bad can the fried shrimp be? Pretty bad. The shrimp tasted like chewy nothing and the batter was squishy. The cole slaw was also pretty bad, with a texture of crunchy nothing mixed with mayonnaise. Even the cocktail sauce was bad.   It's hard to believe I deserved this experience. The shrimp probably came from a processing center in Texas, even though the Atlantic Ocean is only 4 hours away.   In total, the meal cost about $20.00, with the drinks being jacked up in price. For that price, the food was truly awful.   Even though burgers at other tables looked eatable, I couldn't shake the thought that if the chips and salsa were bad, what else could be bad?
ori_text:
I want to establish something before I review my dining experience here:

It doesn't matter how hard I slam this place.  No one that works there can do ANYTHING about it.  If you stocked Chili's with the greatest waitstaff, the greatest chefs, the greatest managers, the greatest dishwashers, et cetera, NONE of them could change the fact that the food is terrible.

So, people of Chilis:

I salute your service.  I am positive that you do your best, every day, to squeeze this fat sloppy pig into that prom dress.  I appreciate everything you tried to do, and I tipped you well.

This being said...

How can I describe my experience here?

Friendly staff: helpful, quick, efficient, wonderful people, all of them.  Really.

The food?

Well.  First off.  Their chips and salsa is bad.  If I bought the least appealing salsa at the grocery-store, and the least appealing chips off the shelf, and put them into a wax-paper lined bowl, it would be very similar to this ""dish"".  

Now.  Ask yourself:  if the chips and salsa are bad...  how bad can the.,..

Fried shrimp be?  Pretty bad.  It comes with fries and cole slaw.  The fries?  The fries are fries.  Eh.   The cole slaw?  Pretty bad.  All together, it looked like a plate of ""brown"" and a ramekin of shredded white, purple, and orange credit cards. 

The shrimp tasted like... nothing.  Like chewy nothing and fried batter that squished when you chewed it.  The cole slaw?  Like crunchy nothing and mayonnaise.  

Even the cocktail sauce was bad.

Do I deserve this?  I mean...  shrimp from Chilis?  Even though the Atlantic Ocean is 4 hours due east, I bet that stuff came from some processing center in Texas.  It was DOA weeks ago when it was bagged, packed into boxes and flash-frozen.

All together...  I think it was about $20.00 because the drinks are jacked up.  Two sodas=like 5 bucks, right?  Off about 3 cents worth of carbonated water and flavored syrup.  They always make money on the drinks...

For the price, the food was awful.  Truly awful.

Burgers that went to other tables LOOKED eatable, but still...  I can't help but keep thinking...  if the chips and salsa is bad...  what else is bad?

cf_text: I was fairly disappointed with this zoo. Signage was unclear. Many of the exhibits were on loan. The food options consisted of a small café with limited choices.
ori_text: I was fairly disappointed with this zoo. Signage was unclear. Many of the exhibits were on loan. The petting zoo consisted of a large pen of goats.

cf_text: I worked about 20 yards away from Tony's for about a year, so I've experienced a lot of what they have to offer in terms of food. I am writing this review because I am utterly shocked that anybody would rate this above 1 or 2 stars when it comes to the food they serve. They don't bother to turn on the lights in the back of the store most days, and even the canned foods in the grocery area are dusty. Additionally, each time I ate here, the sandwich had an odd whang to it that I can't identify. It wasn't *bad* per se, but I quickly learned to spend another 2 dollars for Subway down the street. Furthermore, I ended up coming here for sodas and candy because it was so close to where I worked, but I had to check the expiration date on all the items as I realized that sometimes they were expired. While I am sure that the expired sodas and candy bars weren't dangerous, I did have a few nasty tasting ones from time to time. Also, the prices randomly change based on who is ringing you up. So overall, when it comes to the food, it's an okay stop if you're hard up for cash and have a hankering for a sandwich with a weird taste, but certainly never go out of your way to eat here.
ori_text:
I worked about 20 yards away from Tony's for about a year, so I've experienced a lot of what they have to offer.  I am writing this review because I am utterly shocked that anybody would rate this above 1 or 2 stars.  

They don't bother to turn on the lights in the back of the store most days.  The canned foods in the grocery area are dusty.  I ate here probably half a dozen times, and each time the sandwich had an odd whang to it that I can't identify.  It wasn't *bad* per se, but I quickly learned to spend another 2 dollars for Subway down the street.

I ended up coming here for sodas and candy because it was so close to where I worked, until I caught on that I had to check the expiration date on all the items.  I am sure that the expired sodas and candy bars weren't dangerous, but I sure got a nasty tasing one from time to time.

Also, the prices randomly change based on who is ringing you up.  

It's an OK stop if you're hard up for cash and have a hankering for a sandwich with a weird taste, and don't mind rummaging through foodstuffs to find fresh items.  But certainly never go out of your way to eat here.
